channel.title: Workshop Directory?
channel.description: I'm trying to get the good old M4A1 mod working ([url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=520480508[/url]) and I can't seem to find the actual directory that Black Mesa is sending workshop mods to anymore. Can I even find them or did the system change, and if so, where can I find the workshop mods at? I've searched everywhere for this issue and can't seem to find anything on it.

item.title: Workshop Directory?
item.dc:creator: TornadoAP
item.description:
Heh, I didn’t know the workshop system had changed, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Workshop Directory?
item.dc:creator: KevinJRattman
item.description:
Did you try this folder: [STEAM INSTALLATION DIRECTORY]\SteamApps\workshop\content\362890\520480508

So for example, if you have default installation, it would read C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\workshop\content\362890\520480508

Remember that if you need to install different mods you only need to navigate up to [i]Steam\steamapps[/i]workshop\content\362890

Read full topic

item.title: Workshop Directory?
item.dc:creator: TornadoAP
item.description:
I’m trying to get the good old M4A1 mod working (https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=520480508) and I can’t seem to find the actual directory that Black Mesa is sending workshop mods to anymore. Can I even find them or did the system change, and if so, where can I find the workshop mods at? I’ve searched everywhere for this issue and can’t seem to find anything on it.

Read full topic
